string.text: The Saiga-20 is a Kalashnikov pattern, 20 gauge combat shotgun, manufactured by Izhmash. The Saiga-20 is recognizable by its Kalashnikov design with the large lever safety on the right side of the receiver, the optic mounting rail on the left and the large top mounted dust cover held in place by the rear of the recoil spring assembly. Earning respect in the Zone for its lethality, it is intended for engaging targets at short range (50 metres or less) or in confined spaces.\n %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: \n %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Scopes for dovetail mount

TOZ-134-20 is a 20 caliber shotgun based on the legendary TOZ-34. Intended for professional and amateur hunting, the TOZ-134-20 is an over/under shotgun. Though lacking in capacity, only 2 rounds, it compares well with high-grade shotguns due to its high accuracy of hits. The TOZ-134-20 was designed by N. I. Korovyakov and V. P. Ochnev in 1965. Affordable in price, with high damage output and its ability to unload both rounds instantly make it a popular weapon among rookies on the outskirts of the Zone. Especially useful against mutants thanks to its accuracy and stopping power.\n \n

Intended for professional and amateur hunting the TOZ-134-20 is an over/under shotgun. Modifications made to this gun by removing much of the barrel and the stock makes this shotgun more compact and easier to carry. Popular among rookies and bandits as they can hide it easily in their trench coats.\n \n

A variant of the PP-19 with 35-round magazine chambered for 7.62x25mm Tokarev. It is used by patrol groups, Russian traffic police, Russian security police, and by units of the MVD.\n %c[ui_gray_2]ATTACHMENTS: \n %c[d_purple] • %c[ui_gray_2] Scopes for Picatinny rail
